docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Home
docs.text: Toolbox is a framework that makes it easier to create games using Unity. Many frequently used things by programmers are taken into account in the toolbox and configured in such a way as to reduce the time and number of lines of code spent on them

docs.title: Install with OpenUPM
docs.text:
Once you have the OpenUPM cli, run the following command:

  • Go to your Unity project directory

cd YOUR_UNITY_PROJECT_DIR

  • Install package: com.volumebox.toolbox

openupm add com.volumebox.toolbox

Alternatively, merge the snippet to Packages/manifest.json 

{
    "scopedRegistries": [
        {
            "name": "package.openupm.com",
            "url": "https://package.openupm.com",
            "scopes": [
              "com.volumebox"
              "com.openupm"
            ]
        }
    ],
    "dependencies": {
        "com.volumebox.toolbox": "0.2.4"
    }
}

docs.title: Install via Package Manager
docs.text:
• open Edit/Project Settings/Package Manager

  • add a new Scoped Registry (or edit the existing OpenUPM entry)

    Name: package.openupm.com

    URL: https://package.openupm.com

  • add following scopes:

    com.volumebox.toolbox

    com.dbrizov

    com.solidalloy

    org.nuget

    com.cysharp

  • click Save (or Apply)

  • open My Registries packages in package manager window
  • install VolumeBox Toolbox
